title_en: The National Advocacy Service is negotiating the allocation of funds for a salary increase to avoid a staff strike this week
summary_en:
NAS is negotiating funding to raise employee salaries to avoid a strike.
About 50 employees of the organization intend to go on strike due to a dispute over wages and certification.
Employees say they have been given lower conditions and class structure since the organization was allocated.
NAS claims that the strike could have a negative impact on customers.
The Labor Dispute Court recommended that the management apply for funds to increase wages.
The NAS recognizes the validity of wage increases, but cannot raise rates without adjusting funding.
The strike reflects the deep concern of employees about pay equity and fairness.
